name: toponymic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a toponymic word, name, etc. is one that comes from the name of a place: Toponymic surnames identify the places where people lived. The word "badminton" is toponymic, referring to Badminton House in Gloucestershire.
More examplesFewer examplesBolton is a toponymic surname and is still a common name in the town of Bolton in northern England.His literary style is dense with adjectives, especially toponymic ones.The chemical element's name is toponymic, honouring the place where it was first identified.
